視.definition: (literary, or bound form) to look at

視乎.definition: to be determined by; to depend on

視作.definition: to regard as; to treat as

視同.definition: to regard the same as; to regard as being the same as

視同兒戲.definition: to regard sth as a plaything (idiom); to consider unimportant; to view as trifling

視同己出.definition: to regard sb as one's own child

視同手足.definition: to regard sb as a brother (idiom)

視如土芥.definition: to regard as useless; to view as no better than weeds

視如敝屣.definition: lit. to view as worn-out shoes (idiom); fig. to consider to be worthless

視如糞土.definition: to look upon as dirt; considered worthless

視姦.definition: (neologism) to obsessively monitor sb's social media posts (orthographic borrowing from Japanese 視姦 "shikan", ogling; leering)

視微知著.definition: see 見微知著|见微知著[jian4wei1-zhi1zhu4]

視效.definition: visual effect (abbr. for 視覺效果|视觉效果[shi4jue2 xiao4guo3])

視死如歸.definition: to view death as a return home; to not be afraid of dying; to face death with equanimity (idiom)

視為.definition: to view as; to see as; to consider to be; to deem

視為畏途.definition: to view as dangerous (idiom); afraid to do sth

視為知己.definition: to consider sb as close friend (idiom); to take into one's confidence

視神經乳頭.definition: optic disk (terminal of the optic nerve on the retina)

視神經盤.definition: optic disk (terminal of the optic nerve on the retina)

視而不見.definition: (idiom) to turn a blind eye to; to ignore

視聽材料.definition: evidence of material seen and heard; oral testimony

視若無睹.definition: to turn a blind eye to

視角.definition: angle from which one observes an object; (fig.) perspective; viewpoint; frame of reference; (cinematography) camera angle; (visual perception) visual angle (the angle a viewed object subtends at the eye); (photography) angle of view
